intro: Paraprenanthes yangtoushanensis, commonly known as the Yangtoushan aster, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers bloom in clusters. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
